p: In the same way, a statistical association was observed when comparing individual viral infection and patientâ€™s clinical manifestations ( Table 6). RSV was the most associated virus with respiratory illness reflected by the need for oxygen support, the duration of hospitalization in ICU and nosocomial infections among hospitalized children (p<0.05). PeV came after and was statistically associated with asthma, anemia, and death (p<0.05). Human enterovirus was reported in 8.87% of cases, supporting studies from Vietnam [ 40], Europe [ 41] and Southern Asia [ 42], in which EV was detected in a large fraction of children with ARTIs. Similar to PIVs group and RSV A/B, EV was found to increase the risk of nosocomial infection in hospitalized children (p<0.05).
